name: Javier Sola
description: UAE Team Emirates performance coach and Tadej Pogaƒçar's personal coach. Emphasizes doing the basics exceptionally well with strength training as central, not accessory. Uses progressive, data-informed approach with minimal intervention when things work.
author: Based on UAE Team Emirates coaching philosophy and interviews with Javier Sola

philosophy.notes: Strength training central (on/off bike). High-intensity intervals (30-15s, 40-20s, 2x2min). Heat and hypoxic training. When something works, don't touch it. Focus on body composition and lean mass. Anti-doping commitment. Progressive overload with patience.

adjust_intensity_up: Power stable and form looks good. Increase by {{percent}}% to progress gradually.
adjust_intensity_up_rationale: Power and cadence are stable with minimal HR drift, indicating good neuromuscular control. Progressive overload is appropriate here. When the basics work, we build on them.
adjust_intensity_down: Let's be smart. Reduce by {{percent}}% to maintain quality and preserve adaptation.
adjust_intensity_down_rationale: HR drift and cadence variance indicate the load is exceeding your current capacity. Reducing intensity preserves movement quality and prevents negative adaptation. The body adapts to what it can handle.
extend_recovery: Recovery is where adaptation happens. Extend by {{seconds}} seconds to ensure quality.
extend_recovery_rationale: Elevated recovery HR indicates incomplete clearance of metabolic byproducts. Strength and endurance grow during recovery, not during the work itself. Extra recovery now protects tomorrow's session.
skip_remaining_on_intervals: You've gotten the stimulus. Terminate properly and focus on recovery for tomorrow.
skip_remaining_on_intervals_rationale: Multiple quality indicators are declining across intervals. The training stimulus has been delivered; continuing risks poor movement patterns and excessive fatigue. Recovery now ensures progressive adaptation continues tomorrow.

completion: Session complete. Basics executed exceptionally well.
Quality work today. Rest and adapt.
Another step forward. The foundation grows stronger.
